Grant status indicator

Grant status indicator

Display the current status of a grant.

On this page
  • Visual design
  • Guidelines for use
  • Layouts
  • Examples and assets

Visual design

Open grant

Design view:

Mobile design

Desktop designs can be viewed on screens wider than 650px.

Open
Open date:

1st January 2019

Close date:

1st January 2022.

Application detail:

You can submit an expression of interest for Commercialisation Guidance at any time. After receiving guidance, you may be eligible to apply for a Grant.

CSS styles

Desktop & mobile

Grant status icon and text
p.status {
    color: #333333;
    font-family: OpenSans-Semibold;
    font-size: 18px;
    line-height: 32px;
}
Open icon
.icon-open {
    height: 24px;
    width: 24px;
    color: #219520;
}
.icon-container {
    background: #E8F4E8;
    height: 64px;
    width: 64px;
    border-radius: 50%;
}
Grant information
p.details {
    color: #333333;
    font-family: OpenSans;
    font-size: 16px;
    line-height: 28px;
}
p.details strong {
    font-family: OpenSans-Semibold;
}

Closed grant

Design view:

Mobile design

Desktop designs can be viewed on screens wider than 650px.

Closed
Application detail:

Applications closed June 2019 and will reopen in January 2022.

CSS styles

Desktop & mobile

p.status {
    color: #333333;
    font-family: OpenSans-Semibold;
    font-size: 18px;
    line-height: 32px;
}


.icon-closed {
    color: #E75755;
    height: 24px;
    width: 24px;
}
Grant information

    color: #333333;

Guidelines for use

Purpose:

Displays the status of a grant or program. Either a green tick icon and ‘Open’, or a red no-entry icon and ‘closed’.

When to use this component:

This is added automatically whenever the status of the program is defined on the program page meta content.

Layouts

Page layouts

Grant status indicator components are used in two-third width pages.

Component layout options

Full width layout

Desktop, Tablet & Mobile: One component in a row.

Examples and assets
